intro: Ovieda falcata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ovieda, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, falcate (sickle-shaped) leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or reddish in color. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in disturbed soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
